abstract: The British parliamentary report surprises Rupert Murdoch and implicates the editor of a rival newspaper.
snippet: The British parliamentary report surprises Rupert Murdoch and implicates the editor of a rival newspaper.
lead_paragraph: News Corporation was prepared for severe criticism in the parliamentary report released Tuesday in Great Britain but Rupert Murdoch was taken aback by the personal nature of the committee’s findings, which labeled him “unfit” to lead a major corporation. “Rupert is still in denial about how quickly his influence and prestige in the U.K. has gone down the drain,” said one person close to the company and Mr. Murdoch who could not publicly comment on private discussions.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: ‘Unfit’ to Be Tied and Network Television Looks Up

abstract: Comcast reported net income of $1.22 billion, or 45 cents a share, for the first quarter, up from $943 million, or 34 cents a share, and above analysts’ expectations. But it also reported that 37,000 cable TV customers cancelled the service.
snippet: Comcast reported net income of $1.22 billion, or 45 cents a share, for the first quarter, up from $943 million, or 34 cents a share, and above analysts’ expectations. But it also reported that 37,000 cable TV customers cancelled the service.
lead_paragraph: One year after taking control of NBCUniversal, Comcast posted a quarterly profit on Wednesday that exceeded analyst expectations and signaled progress at the struggling NBC broadcast network.

headline.main: Comcast Reports Progress at NBC, but Declines in Cable Subscriptions

abstract: The Federal Communications Commission said Comcast must program the less-watched cable channel in the same “neighborhood” on the cable dial as competitors like Fox Business and CNBC and more general news channels like CNN and MSNBC.
snippet: The Federal Communications Commission said Comcast must program the less-watched cable channel in the same “neighborhood” on the cable dial as competitors like Fox Business and CNBC and more general news channels like CNN and MSNBC.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Communications Commission ruled in favor of Bloomberg TV on Wednesday, saying Comcast must program the less-watched cable channel in the same “neighborhood” on the cable dial as competitors like Fox Business and CNBC and more general news channels like CNN and MSNBC.

headline.main: Commission Rules for Bloomberg TV in Dial Dispute With Comcast
